sentences.displayText: Okay, welcome everyone to our next meeting.
I'm busy writing and busy leading the meeting, but I've prepared a little presentation once again or at least an agenda I think the biggest part of the presentation will be on your side.
We are here at the conceptual design meeting, which is hereby opened.
Once again I will try to write some minutes which I just from the previous meeting placed inside our project folder, which was quite some typing.
Today we once again have three presentations, if I'm right, and after that we will take a decision on the remote control concepts.
And just as the last time we have forty minutes to accomplish that.
Okay, I'd say let's start with the first presentation.
In the same order as last time?
Components design, first of all I would like to accommodate some of those things I elaborate some of the things I did.
I I elaborated on the concept.
What should be said about the components, its properties and what kind of materials should we use to make one of those remote controls.
First of all I've subtracted some of the components that are used are from what the remote control's formed.
First of all, the case, the surrounding of the remote control.
I would like to give you an idea of how I thought about.
Okay the case is made from rubber, I suppose.
There's one of the because when you use a remote control a lot of people will drop their remote control and titanium was also an option.
But it's a very expensive material.
Rubber is, the best suitable material to use for our remote control.
It's also possible to create fancy colours with rubber.
Rubber makes it easy to to it lets itself colour.
Titanium you have to paint it and with that it's possible to scratch it or make it ugly.
The total piece of rubber that's that's used to make the case is the same colour, so if you scratch it it's still the same colour, perhaps it's a little bit damaged.
But it's a very strong material.
I had an idea single covered curved, sorry, single curved.
I think it's best to green.
You have to go it's a side view.
I thought of an idea like this.
So it also looks nice when it's on your table.
So it doesn't lay flat down on the table, but it's stands.
Yes it's side view so I'm not technically good at three D modelling, but.
It's just an idea I had it's very so its also looks nice when it's on the table.
The graphical user interface and the buttons, we also thought about that already.
I thought about the LCD touch screen, which is easy to clean too.
One of the great advantages of the LCD screen you just use some or cleaning some cleaning stuff.
And it should be made of strong plastic and it should be bright.
I already explained some properties of that material and I think we almost concluded about that this should be our button component.
So that's all about the buttons.

The batteries, we also thought about that already, will be chargeable with an option for a mount station so you can put the remote control in a mount station so its charges itself up instead of plugging it in or something like that.
And they should be long lasting, not be empty in about two minutes or thirty minutes or forty minutes of use.
And next step is the chip the component.

There was an option to use a rather simple chip because of our highly requiring requirements, there should be an advanced chip in it with also the ability to facilitate speech recognition which unfortunately is still in a test phase, so there should be some more investigation on that side.
My personal preferences I also overheard in the last meeting that there we should use our own business colours.
I think they are rather boring for use with rubber.
Business colours I thought it was the slogan and the corporate image, so it needs colour, but I don't think you have to make the entire thing in the corporate colour.
Okay they should be in mind, wasn't it?
Okay so it doesn't says to have the slogan?
